flowRoot.flowPara: "The Olympic Museum is aimed at everyone who is passionate about sport and the Olympic Movement, at all those interested in history, culture and art and at anyone with an interest in the future of our society. We are very proud to have the opportunity to showcase this unique Museum which promotes the union of sport, art and culture." - Jacques Rogge, IOC President

"Donating an item to the Olympic Museum collection means immortalising the greatest moments in the history of sport, guaranteeing the future of a precious heritage and providing an essential resource for the education of young people."

By donating an item to The Olympic Museum collection, official Museum of the International Olympic Committee, you become an ambassador for the Olympic Values around the world and particularly for young people.
Your donated items will enable us to:
provide items on loan and arrange travelling exhibitions across the globe
develop educational programmes both in Lausanne and around the world
To leave a lasting impression on more than a million visitors every year in Lausanne and elsewhere!
Share Your Emotions With The World
Items donated by athletes will bring Olympic history to life:
donation of equipment used during the competition
donation of equipment which illustrates the evolution of performance-related technology
donation of testimonial material on a particularly special gesture or the magic of an Olympic moment
The donation can be made by the athlete or via a member of his/her entourage (coach, Chef de Mission, etc.)
At the IOC Corner in the residential zone of the Beijing Olympic Village. The Olympic Museum can also pick up donations elsewhere by appointment.
From 5 to 25 August 2008 at the IOC Corner, or even after the Games have finished if you prefer (logistics to be organised by The Olympic Museum).
How Do You Go About It?
You’ll find us in the tent at the IOC Corner which is located in front of the main restaurant in the Olympic Village,
Feel free to contact us at any time:
Mr Francis Gabet: The Olympic Museum Director
Ms Frédérique Jamolli: The Olympic Museum Curator
Ms Anne Chevalley: Head of Educational and Cultural Services Ms Rachel Caloz: Exhibitions Manager
Ms Anne-Cécile Jaccard: Exhibitions Project Officer

The Olympic Museum, founded by the International Olympic Committee, is the international home of sporting, historic and artistic artefacts related to the Olympic Movement. It conserves the heritage of both the Summer and Winter Games and cham- pions the ideals of Olympism, ranging from sport, art and culture to the future of our society.
Surface area 11’000 m2 on five floors and a park of 22’000 m2
Since its inauguration in 1993, The Olympic Museum

125 temporary exhibitions around 30 off-site exhibitions or major loans each year around 10 travelling exhibitions every year It has also taken part in no fewer than 27500 public and private demonstrations
The IOCs collection comprises: 140000 objects 517000 photos 30000 hours of film
